page.title: 18LOCAL AFFAIRS
page.content: Riponians are very much aware of their past history and traditions.The local council tries hard to keep its independence and to protect Ripon's heritage.The past 5 years of local politics have been dominated by the issue of where to build a relief road. Ripon's city centre often resembles "spaghetti junction"with hundreds of heavy lorries and cars passing through the narrow streets every hour.Most people accept the need for a relief road but some people favour an outer relief road.It is argued that an inner relief road would split the town in two and cause the demolition of many old builings.This plan has finally been rejected and so heavy vehicles continue to rumble through the market square.
